DataElement.preferredName: Common Toxicity Criteria Adverse Event Seizure Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A description of the common toxicity criteria adverse event seizure.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Common Toxicity Criteria Adverse Event Seizure
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the CTC adverse event of seizure.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A standard terminology developed to report adverse events occurring in cancer clinical trials.  Common terminology criteria for adverse events (CTCAE) are used in study adverse event summaries and Investigational New Drug reports to the Food and Drug Administration.  The CTCAE contain a grading scale for each adverse event term representing the severity of the event.

Concepts.longName: Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events
Concepts.definition: A standard terminology developed to report adverse events occurring in cancer clinical trials.  Common terminology criteria for adverse events (CTCAE) are used in study adverse event summaries and Investigational New Drug reports to the Food and Drug Administration.  The CTCAE contain a grading scale for each adverse event term representing the severity of the event.

Property.preferredDefinition: the most dramatic type of seizure, characterized by tonic and clonic contraction of most skeletal muscles.

Concepts.definition: Sudden, involuntary skeletal muscular contractions of cerebral or brain stem origin.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition:
any unfavorable symptoms, signs, or disease temporally associated with the use of a medical
treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical
treatment or procedure.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Sudden, involuntary skeletal muscular contractions of cerebral or brain stem origin._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A seizure that originates in a single area of the brain that affects consciousness.

Concepts.definition: A seizure that originates in one area of the brain that affects consciousness.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.: Sudden, involuntary skeletal muscular contractions of cerebral or brain stem origin.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
Sudden, involuntary skeletal muscular contractions of cerebral or brain stem origin.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A transitory alteration in movement, sensation or autonomic nerve function due to abnormal electric activity in a localized area of the cerebral cortex, usually without change in awareness or alertness. Symptoms vary with different lesion locations and may include but not limited to the motor (e.g. rhythmic muscle contractions in one area of the body), somatosensory and sensory alterations manifested by abnormal numbness, paresthesias or other hallucinations, including several types of aura; autonomic and psychic symptoms, e.g. with changes in speech, thought, personality, mood, sensation of deja vu or hallucinations.

Concepts.definition: A transitory alteration in movement, sensation or autonomic nerve function due to abnormal electric activity in a localized area of the cerebral cortex, usually without change in awareness or alertness. Symptoms vary with different lesion locations and may include but not limited to the motor (e.g. rhythmic muscle contractions in one area of the body), somatosensory and sensory alterations manifested by abnormal numbness, paresthesias or other hallucinations, including several types of aura; autonomic and psychic symptoms, e.g. with changes in speech, thought, personality, mood, sensation of deja vu or hallucinations.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Changed definition to match current NCIt per NHLBI request. 9.7.18 mc

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A generalized tonic-clinic seizure, characterized by loss of consciousness. This type of seizure may be preceded by an aura and is frequently followed by a period of confusion and lethargy (post-ictal state).

Concepts.definition: A generalized seizure that is characterized by a loss of consciousness and violent muscle contractions. This type of seizure may be preceded by an aura and is frequently followed by a period of confusion and lethargy (post-ictal state).

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Updated definition per NHLBI request to match current NCIt. 9.7.18 mc

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A life-threatening situation in which the brain is in a continuous state of seizure.

Concepts.definition: A life-threatening situation in which the brain is in a continuous state of seizure.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Status epilepticus without prominent motor symptoms, the duration of which is at least ten minutes.

Concepts.definition: Status epilepticus without prominent motor symptoms, the duration of which is at least ten minutes.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A seizure with no apparent symptoms.

Concepts.definition: A seizure with no apparent symptoms.
